turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: You know how to drive one of these things?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Can a pig whistle?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Hit the brakes!

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: They're jammed!

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Let's get the hell outta here.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Shouldn't we pay 'em for the damages?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Right. Give me your pen. We'll tell 'em to bill Kyle.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: We still on schedule?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Forty-two minutes ahead.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I hate to say I told you so.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Save it. We got a long haul.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Clear and rolling.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Bandit I, do you copy?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: This is Bandit I, come back.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You can't swear on these.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: What's going on, Bandit? Come on.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Tell him we'll be back on the highway in a second.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: This is Bandit II. Now, where the hell are you?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: On two lane blacktop. Mile marker six-one. How we doin' on time?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Thirty-eight minutes ahead of schedule.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What's your twenty?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'm 'bout four miles ahead of you, turkey.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Not for long, you ain't.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: What's a Texas Smokey doing in Arkansas, man?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: If I knew, Cledus; I'd be on College Bowl.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I hope that's you, buddy; 'cause I'd hate to start believing in ghosts.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What does the old Timex say?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: She's losing minutes so you better start running interference or we're never gonna make it. Might I remind you this was your brainstorm.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I'll drop off my fare, hit a quick choke-and-puke and be blocking for you pronto.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Bandit?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah, guy?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Pick up a burger for Fred. He's going crazy.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: My vocal cords are fine, but Fred's ain't. He's been barking, eating the seats and driving me crackers.  Hear that? Where's his chow?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: On its way. Give me a coupla minutes, okay?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Do I have a choice?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What's your twenty?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: 'Bout fourteen miles this side of Mississippi.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I'm still trying to ditch this Texas Smokey. I don't know what the sucker wants.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: What they all want -- to handcuff a hero.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: As far as John Law knows, I'm just a joy ridin' Georgia redneck. We keep 'em outta your backyard, we're cool.  Now just give me five to ditch this idiot and I'll meet you in Ole Miss.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: If you don't, we can kiss that Kenworth good-bye.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: -- Gimme a twenty, pardner.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'm at marker eight-five.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Son-of-a-gun. Me too.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I thought you were dumping the chick at the truck stop.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I ran into complications.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I hate to say it...

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Then don't.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: -- But everytime we've ever messed up, it's because your rhyme's over- ruling your reason. I know you think you're God's gift to waitresses, but...

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Just don't worry about it.  How we doin' timewise?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Not good enough to be standing here shooting the bull.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: We're gone.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Bandit?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Never mind. It's nothing.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Anything else you don't want me to know?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Nope. Just keep those wheels churning.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Bandit two, I gotta make a quick pit stop.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: We're outta motion lotion.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'll keep streaking. Pick me up.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: -- Looks like a clear shot to the 'Bama State Line.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'll believe it when I see it.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'm all ears, good buddy.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You're gonna hit some heavy precipitation in about six minutes. Better let your flaps down, these roads are killers when they're damp.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: It shouldn't last. Gives me time to take a go-go juice break.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: We'll be waiting. Over.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Ran into a little hassle at the eatum- up-stop.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Just fine. What's the weather like?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: God's back on our side, so let's get smokin'.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Roger. Keep the shiny side up and the greasy side down.  Right, Fred?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: -- How we doing?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: It's gonna be close. Real close.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Talk to me.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: We're gonna have to do a little tightrope act.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Let's boogie.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'm all ears.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You're about to hit a convoy. Tighten up your rubber band. The oncoming's clear.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Bandit II?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'm here.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You're coming up to the scale house.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'm cucumber cool.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Bandit I, let me offer my heartiest congratulations and a piece of advice.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What's that, pardner?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Don't take that foot off the hammer, 'cause you got wall-to-wall Bears about to pour over you like maple syrup.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: How's the clock, Bandit II.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Ticking away, but it looks like a clear shot to Hot Town. Green lights and white lines all the way.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Are you loco, pardner!?! We've come this far.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah, but...

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: When we agree to do a job, we do it. Right?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: But they're waiting for me. They don't even know Cledus Snow exists.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Well, they're gonna. It's time this gearjammer rode to glory.  Now, move aside; good buddy. I'm coming through.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Breaker. Breaker.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Go breaker.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Bandit, I just thought I'd lay a Smokey report on you.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Go head on, breaker.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I would say your future's looking dim, boss.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What's your twenty and what's your handle?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: My handle's Smokey Bear and I got you by the tail.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: My handle's Silver Tongued Devil and I'm here to tell you, your fellow CB'ers are mighty proud of y'all.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Thanks much, Silver Tongued Devil.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Breaker. Breaker.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Pick it up, Breaker.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Thanks for the break. Bandit, this here's the Dixie Chicken.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What's up, Dixie Chicken?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Breaker, Breaker. This is Bandit I, coming up on a portable gas station. Do you copy?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Bandit, this is Mister B, and I'm gearjamming this rolling refinery. You got another Smokey on the rubber?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What else?  Can you give me cover, Mister B?

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: It ain't ever been done before, hot shit.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: See, running Coors Beer east of Texas is what bothers me. It makes me a bootlegger.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: I think you're just yellow.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Wonderful psychology. Why don't you say something about my mom?  Excuse me.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: Pop, a K-Whopper's worth seventy thou.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Seventy-two five.  Why do you want this barley pop so bad?

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: He's thirsty.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: Have any trouble getting here?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: About one to five years worth.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Gimme three sloppy joes and a coupla cups of hot stuff.

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: You pass that funky Cobra on the highway?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Uh-uh. What Cobra?

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: Some boy named Bandit's been givin' the Highway Patrol shit fits.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Oh, yeah. Good for him.

turns.speaker: OWNER
turns.text: I don't know where he's goin' or what he's doin', but I sure hope to God he makes it.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Listen, pardner; this ain't no time to be getting laid.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Believe me, that won't be a problem.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: This is Bandit I. Over.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Where the hell are you?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Smokey was on our tail. We had to take a detour to ditch the motherfu...

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Shut up, Fred.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Who's Fred?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Bandit II. We'll be back on the highway in a second. Over.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I'll keep my eyeballs peeled.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah, Bandit II, Que pasa?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: That's a Texas bubble gum machine on your back porch.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What's he...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I'm Kate. You must be Cledus.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How's your twenty?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Bandit two, you read me?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: You're soundin' real bodacious. Back.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: Is that Bandit in the lead?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: If that sumbitch was in the race, he'd be in the winner's circle by now.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: I still think this whole idea is dumb, pop.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Then it must be a helluva idea.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: Why don't we just rent a Lear jet and haul it back ourselves?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Because I wanna see this hot shot Bandit do something that can't be done. Besides, there's nothing I like better than breaking legends.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: But if it can't be done, how's he gonna do it?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: That's the point, Dickey.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Now, you just find him, son.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: Five thou.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Chickenshit money.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: That crazy sumbitch made it.

turns.speaker: DICKEY
turns.text: Congratulations. You just became a legend maker.

turns.speaker: VOICE ONE
turns.text: -- Breaker, this is Banana Peel...

turns.speaker: VOICE TWO
turns.text: -- Yeah, Breaker go head on.

turns.speaker: VOICE ONE
turns.text: -- Thanks much. I'd like to get me a Smokey report?

turns.speaker: VOICE TWO
turns.text: -- Road looks clean as a hound's tooth.

turns.speaker: VOICE ONE
turns.text: -- Okey, doke. Last one to the Roadeo is a homo.

turns.speaker: VOICE ONE
turns.text: -- Breaker, Breaker. This is Banana Peel.

turns.speaker: VOICE TWO
turns.text: -- Yeah, Banana Peel, go head on.

turns.speaker: VOICE ONE
turns.text: -- Did ya hear they nailed the Bandit?

turns.speaker: VOICE TWO
turns.text: -- Yeah, I heard. But they won't hold him for long. Anyway, he sure gave them sumbitches a run for their money.

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: It's gotta be tough keeping an eye on everything.

turns.speaker: SECURITY SUPERVISOR
turns.text: And everybody, all the time. Yeah, it's a chore.

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: So, Bill, if I understand this right, you currently have your penthouse floor under construction?

turns.speaker: SECURITY SUPERVISOR
turns.text: That's correct.

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: But with these down, doesn't that pose a major security concern if, as you say, you have to keep an eye on everything at all times?

turns.speaker: SECURITY SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Well, we were worried about dust and debris from the work being done ruining the cameras, so--

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: -- so you shut them off?

turns.speaker: SECURITY SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Yes, but no -- we have personnel stationed at both ends of that hall, twenty-four hours a day.

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: What kind of personnel?

turns.speaker: SECURITY SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Right now? A six man security force, plus a member of our Butler staff. So seven men total.

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: You have a butler working that floor?

turns.speaker: SECURITY SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Uh -- well, yes, uh just in terms of the men up there now, my team, he's serving lunch and dinner and just doing general upkeep so --

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: So there are no guests staying on that floor?

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: C'mon Bill... you've got some Sultan up there, one of your whales, big- spender, likes a lot of space, you cook up this "construction" thing...?

turns.speaker: SECURITY SUPERVISOR
turns.text: No, no, no. We've been looking to renovate that area of our hotel for some time now. The security team is only present to preserve floor integrity, due to the roof access.

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: Is your security team armed?

turns.speaker: SECURITY SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Of course. Yes.

turns.speaker: ACOSTA
turns.text: And who has access to that floor?

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Anything on the Swede?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Only the mention made in that phone call. There's no Swedish hitman of any renown, much less one with a million dollar day rate.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Maybe he's that good. Never been caught, no criminal record.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: I tell you, engineering this kind of play against Sparazza, going to the lengths these guys are going to... they're playing some long odds.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: And a very bad gamble.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Well... This is as good a place for it as any I guess.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Spotter on the lake confirmed Israel. Penthouse level. There was apparently a fisticuffs with some prostitutes. He wasn't involved. He's also had his people phone a local madame for another group of girls.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: No rest for the wicked.  Why were we never shown these files? We're sitting on Sparazza for what? Six months now and we're just seeing this?  Did you know that he's has had thirty- six major medical procedures performed on him since 1953?  Elective plastic surgery, every single one --

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Unreal, this guys jacket too. Wall- to-wall major felony offenses, murder, extortion, arson, grand larceny --  -- A paternity suit... I just feel like we're playing catch-up with all this and we shouldn't be.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Welcome to the new Bureau. Nobody shares information anymore, it's become synonymous with job security.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Based on what we had, I thought Sparazza was a mid-level player at best and it turns out he's this mob relic, running the show out west.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: But the Bureau knew Sparazza killed Heller. Why not go after him, guns blazing' for that one?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Heller was buried in agency lore, anytime an operative failed or was perceived to have failed, Hoover blackballed their memory. Look at Ness.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Yeah, but the Untouchables took down Capone. Heller got shot and killed. The bad guys beat him. Worse, Sparazza walked.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: So he has no idea what's about to happen?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: No. And I want to be in that room a half second after Mecklen calls to say the deal's done. We've got a sheriff's task force on stand-by.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: What about the hotel staff obstructing us. Israel's obviously paid off the management.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Tampering with a witness extraction of this magnitude makes everyone indictable at the federal level.  Trust me, we won't any problems with the hotel staff. You show 'em your ID with the letters "F.B.I." in all caps and it's instant compliance. I've seen in happen a hundred times.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: He's giving them up?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: All of 'em. His entire entourage. I think we should move.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Did the Justice lawyers sign off?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: That's happening in about ten minutes. Israel's at optimum risk of flight right now, so we can't wait.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: What about the sheriff's task force?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Have them mobilized. I'll phone security and have the elevators locked down and stairwells secured. We need to keep Israel sequestered in that penthouse.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Deputy, have you made any ID's?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Get a coroner's estimate too.  -- Miss, I've been transferred and I was disconnected. No one is answering and I need someone from security to pick up that line. It's urgent.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Maroon uniforms?

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Yeah. Have you been able to get through to the Nomad's security?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: No.  I'm going over there. You take the car from there, get out to the lake.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: How bad?

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Mortal.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CARRUTHERS
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CASINO EMPLOYEE
turns.text: Yeah, ye-- I -- uh, there were, earlier, there was that guy Carrut--

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: -- Agent Carruthers. Do you know where is he now?

turns.speaker: CASINO EMPLOYEE
turns.text: He uh -- he asked about -- I'm -- he wanted to know whic-- what floor security was on, then I saw him get on the elevator with the other agent.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Wait a minute, what other agent?  What other agent?

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Did he give you his name?

turns.speaker: CASINO EMPLOYEE
turns.text: Yeah, uh -- it was Spanish-somethin' Garcia, or Diego, uh --

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: -- run both those names through the D.C. database. Call San Francisco, see if they've got anybody in the field doing collateral inquiries for --

turns.speaker: CASINO EMPLOYEE
turns.text: -- he was wearing one of our jackets.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: CASINO EMPLOYEE
turns.text: The other agent. He said he was here to do an inspection and later, when he got on the elevator with the other guy, Carruthers, I saw him wearing one of our security jackets...

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: This man wearing the jacket identified himself as an Federal agent?

turns.speaker: CASINO EMPLOYEE
turns.text: Uh, yeah.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: You're sure?

turns.speaker: CASINO EMPLOYEE
turns.text: Yeah, he had the badge and everything. It said "FBI" on it.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: And when you saw him later, he was wearing one of your security jackets --

turns.speaker: CASINO EMPLOYEE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MESSNER
turns.text: And that didn't seem odd to you?

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: You investigating those murders out at the lake?

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Ww... uh...

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: Three men were ambushed and shot, two died and had their bodies tossed into the lake, the other has severe hypothermia, possible dementia and will probably be a multiple amputee by week's end... if he even lives that long.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Yeah, shit -- hell, you're right. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: You shot me and murdered my friends.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: I did. We -- yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: And threw us into the lake.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Pretty much, yep.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: And this is your car, isn't it?

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Mmm-hmm.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: But there were more of you?

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Yeah, m'brothers... They didn't make it.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: Two of 'em?

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Thass' right.  I got other brother's though, so it ain't so bad.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: You were here huntin' a man named Israel, weren't you? Your name is Tremor.

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: ...I forgive you Darwin.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Shoot, I appreciate that man.

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: If I needed your I.D. and your car and me and my brothers were wanted by the law, I woulda killed you to get 'em too.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: You woulda?

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: Oh hell yeah. We's just in the wrong place at the wrong time. So don't feel so bad dude.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Damn... alright then.

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: I don't mind now anyway. You know, up here in Heaven, it's beautiful. Way better than fuckin' Hawaii or any place like that.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: I'm glad I'm here. I love it. I'm gonna get laid by some fine ass angels and then go hang out with Jesus and them.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: Man, that's great.

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: I got it made in the shade Amigo. Hey, I'll see you up here some day, don't worry.

turns.speaker: DARWIN TREMOR
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Are you on a land line?

turns.speaker: DR. GILL
turns.text: Yeah, why.

turns.speaker: DR. GILL
turns.text: I've got concerns.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: ...About what?

turns.speaker: DR. GILL
turns.text: About cocaine... and the amount you're doing.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: I'm not doing cocaine.

turns.speaker: DR. GILL
turns.text: Buddy, I'm not an ethics professor, I'm a physician, be honest, or be dead within a day... s'your choice.

turns.speaker: DR. GILL
turns.text: -- Forget about the tissue damage you're doing to the heart itself. Sustained cocaine abuse will segue you from a very painful ventricular fibrillation into full cardiac arrest.  Buddy, nobody knows about your condition, or your drug use. Why you lied to me, knowing that I'd find out anyway, I'll never know, but it imperative now that I see you.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: That's not possible. I told you.

turns.speaker: DR. GILL
turns.text: There are certain meds, certain intravenous measures that can counteract some of the damage you've done, but I'd have to administer them myself.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Won't work, we're just gonna have to chance it man. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DR. GILL
turns.text: No. Sorry comes later, when you're in a partial coma with ambulatory paralysis. Sorry comes when we have to decide which of your limbs have to be amputated because severely constricted blood flow has brought about a gangrenous infection, sorry --

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: -- Fine, fuck, I got it... Lake Tahoe, Nevada. I'll have Hugo book your flight, you can be here in a couple hours. He'll meet you at the airport.

turns.speaker: DR. GILL
turns.text: I'm here, where's the car?

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: I sent Hugo, he should be there!

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: The Teamsters had a reform measure going to ballot that didn't sit too well with the local syndicate. Night of the polling, big black-tie to-do downtown and the Tremor Brothers crash the party. Literally.

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: His law firm, same one that hired me. Israel walked out after he made bail and nobody's seen him since.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: Jack, if the rumors hold and Israel is really the great white whale of snitches, then the mob is looking to put all kinds of bullets into his ass and pour some serious psychotics into the mix to do just that. So what real incentive is there to track him on something as small-time as a skip trace, when it's putting you and yours in the path of severe pain and suffering and an almost certain prelude to doom.

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: So I guess you're not going.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: Shit, if you're on a crazy jag, why stop there, why not take Fort Knox with a fucking slingshot or go into Hell after Hitler... I like your chances a lot more.

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: I know his location, we've got the drop of a maybe half a day before that location gets grape-vined and the rest of the world gets hipped.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: That's already happened hoss. It's naive to think otherwise.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: Yeah, we've been through that.

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: Then quit acting like somebody shit in your cereal bowl. Reed just gave us fifty grand.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: -- Jack, what am I doing? I'm standing here, aren't I?  Shouldn't that be enough? That I made the trip?

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: Your attitude sucks.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: I been accused of worse.  What do we got...?

turns.speaker: DUPREE
turns.text: Two security levels, the one we're going in under the guise of, hotel security, has restricted access. They're mostly there to monitor the lobby, handle disturbances on the different floors and toss out drunks.  There's a thirty-five member employee rotation going from graveyard to day shift. If we split up, we can blend in and enter unnoticed. Once we're inside the hotel, we'll regroup.

turns.speaker: ELMORE
turns.text: Then what --

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: D'you talk to'm?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I got his machine.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: What'd you say?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I said I got his machine.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: No, what did you say on the machine?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I left him a message.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: I know you left him a message. What did you say!

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Jesus Hugo! How is it that you can turn a simple conversation into a fucking hedge maze!? This is zero degree of difficulty man!

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Then why are you still looking at me like I'm asking for the square root of something! What did you say!?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I said that we were returning his call and you were real concerned, because he sounded real concerned.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Look at that, we didn't have to fill up the whole blackboard after all. Now, do you know anything about that?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Look at the collar on that coat...

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I dunno... Cinnamon roll?

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Cinnamon roll? No, good guess though. No, Hugo that looks like jizz...  And I'm no forensic expert mind you, but that looks like some fuckhead shot their load on a twelve-thousand dollar calf's skin jacket. The twist? It's My twelve thousand dollar, calf's skin jacket.  So y'got semen, human ejaculate --  -- that's been allowed to soak in for what, six, seven hours now? Work it's way into the fabric-fuck'n fibers -- and while you may never see it in a Tide commercial, I think it still safely qualifies as a "tough, deep down stain."

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I could have it sent out...

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: ...to what? Incinerate? 'Cuz I'm almost dead certain there's not a fucking laundry detergent or dry cleaning process known to man that can ever return that jacket to its former glory! Some shit, suffice it to say, just don't wash out.  Now, the money question... To whom does that stain belong?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: Do you want me to say I did it?

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: I was kinda hoping, yeah.

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: Do you want me to say I'm sorry?

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Only if you really, truly mean it.

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: ...I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Are you a fucking colossal idiot?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I am. Yeah.

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Without peer?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: I -- uh, yeah, I guess, yeah.

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: Answer your fucking pages! I've been calling for fifteen minutes, we need you up here to clean NOW!

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: That's right! RIGHT NOW!

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Fifty grand gouge. South shore hayseeds, this is why I never play Tahoe, or redneck Reno...

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: We're hot, and they're losing a whole floor's worth of business saying it's "under construction."

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: Alright, bag it, I'm not shelling out that kinda bread for this shithole, this is a junior suite in Vegas. Call Mecklen right now, he should have his cell on, I need an update.  Get the Russian up here, have him clean this place, floor to ceiling and get us packed.  ...And send out for some new skeeze, the sun's up, these ones are starting to stink...

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: That's probably him now...

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: ...See, this is one'a them rare moments when y'ass get a chance to be completely honest... and if I'm asking you what you said to Mecklen, assume the shit is rhetorical... so assume I already know.

turns.speaker: SIR IVY
turns.text: Y'ain't never had to wash another man's blood off, dig it out y'fingernails... Y'had us for that. Y'ain't ever made a real beef on y'own, shit as light in the ass as you are, I'll bet you ain't ever made anything more than a fuck'n fist your whole life.  So if you think I'mma let your lil' punk-ass, with the dirt I've done for you, in the eleventh hour, sell me off like some fucking field nigger, hand me up to the Feds like y'last chip, then you done gone straight out-your-motherfucking MIND!

turns.speaker: ISRAEL
turns.text: That's Mecklen. The deal's closing. I can pick that phone up and I can work this out.  You'll walk with me.
